ocean.core
Class FishMatrix

java.lang.Object
  ocean.core.FishMatrix
Direct Known Subclasses:
FishMatrixSimple
public abstract class FishMatrix
extends java.lang.Object

A matrix of fish of constant size.

There are access method getFish and setFish to request or set a fish on givern coordinates. It is possible to add a direction parameter getFish or setFish, to get/set the position one step in that direction. The simulation step is entirely done in moveAllFish().

public boolean validCoordinate(Coordinate coord)
tells whether the cell (x,y) exists in the matrix

Parameters:

Returns:

canMove

public boolean canMove(Coordinate from,
                       Direction dir)
tells whether there is a cell in the direction dir from the cell (x,y) in the matrix

Parameters:
from - The start position.
dir - The direction to go to.
Returns:
true if a move in that direction is possible (ignoring other fish)

getFish

public Fish getFish(Coordinate coord)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the fish on the coordinates (x,y).

Parameters:
coord - the coordinate
Returns:
A fish object or null if there is no fish in that cell
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the cell does not exist.

setFish

public void setFish(Coordinate coord,
                    Fish fish)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Stores a fish on the coordinates (x,y). It's allowed to pass null in order to clear this cell and delete the fish which was stored.

Parameters:
coord - The coordinate
fish - the fish to be stored
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the cell does not exist

getCoordinate

public Coordinate getCoordinate(Coordinate from,
                                Direction dir)
Returns the Coordinate of the cell reached when starting in cell from and moving one step in direction dir.

Parameters:
from - the Coordinate where we start
dir - the direction we want to go
Returns:
the resulting new Coordinate or null, if this move is not allowed

getFish

public Fish getFish(Coordinate from,
                    Direction direction)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the fish in the cell reached when starting in cell (x,y) and moving one step in direction direction.

Parameters:
from - The start position.
direction - the direction
Returns:
A fish object or null if there is no fish in that cell
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the cell does not exist.

moveFish

protected abstract Coordinate moveFish(Fish fish,
                                       Coordinate from,
                                       Coordinate to)
Moves a single fish one step, possibly overwriting any fish the fish moves into.

Parameters:
fish - The fish to set at the new location.
from - The coordinate where the fish should be removed.
to - The coordinate where the fish should be moved to.
Returns:
The new coordinate of the fish. This does not necessarily have to be to the same as to.

moveAllFish

public abstract void moveAllFish()
Moves all fish one iteration, the most important method of this class.

whereIsMyFish

public Coordinate whereIsMyFish(Fish fish)
Returns the coordinate of a Fish object in the matrix. Note that this does not use equals(), but really looks for the same object.

Parameters:
fish - The fish to find.
Returns:
The coordinate or null.

fillMatrix

public void fillMatrix(java.util.LinkedList<Fish> manyFish)
Inserts a List of Fish randomly into the Matrix.

Parameters:
manyFish - The List containing all the Fish to be inserted.

doSomething

public java.lang.String doSomething(Coordinate where)
Passes the doSomething-command to the fish at the specified position. If there is no fish, it reports that.

Parameters:
where - The coordinate that was prompted to do something.
Returns:
The response of the fish or that there is an empty field.
